New Records: The Cavaliers are the first team in NBA history to win their first 10 games and score at least 110 points in each of them.
The Cavaliers have the highest points per game average at 124.5 and a.526 field goal percentage.
Key Match Events: Darius Garland scored 27 points and Evan Mobley had 23 as the Cavaliers routed the Golden State Warriors 136-117.
The Cavaliers built a 41-point halftime lead at 83-42.
Pre-Game Insights: Kenny Atkinson’s high-powered offense has been a great fit for Cleveland.
Under now-Detroit coach JB Bickerstaff last season, the Cavaliers averaged 112.6 points and shot.479 from the field.
Post-Match Reflections: Kenny Atkinson couldn’t help but smile as he looked at the box score and stared at the record of his Cleveland Cavaliers.
Donovan Mitchell noted that the Cavaliers still haven’t reached their potential.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The only significant change made by general manager Koby Altman was hiring Atkinson after he spent three years as an assistant under Steve Kerr with the Warriors.
Cleveland has outshot their opponent in each game, but has only won the rebounding battle four times.
Others: The Cavaliers have utilized their depth with ten players averaging at least 15 minutes a game, but none are logging more than 30.
Backup guard Ty Jerome scored a season-high 20 points against the Warriors.
